oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mickey Gilley and Johnny Lee Live at the Ritz Theatre - 1981-01-24 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from Ritz Theatre live show. The tape features a live performance of Mickey Gilley (musician) and Johnny Lee (musician). The Ritz Theatre live show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Mickey Gilley and Johnny Lee is from January 24, 1981. Tape is the first part of two.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mickey Gilley; Johnny Lee
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Lee Arnold greets the crowd and introduces the Urban Cowboy Band -- (01:07) Unidentified tune (Urban Cowboy Band) -- (06:35) Mickey Gilley greets the crowd -- (06:56) Hey Bartender (Mickey Gilley and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (10:58) Hello Texas (Mickey Gilley and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (13:48) Gilley reflects on becoming an overnight sensation -- (14:13) You Can Never Lie My Lovin' Down (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (17:44) Redneck Mother (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (21:48) Do You Love as Good as You Look (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (25:00) Annie (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (27:54) Much Too Young (To Feel This Damn Old) (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (30:57) Sawing on a Fiddle Beats Sawing on a Log (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (34:42) Gilley addresses the crowd -- (35:14) Slow Down Old World (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (38:28) One in a Million (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (41:42) Pickin' Up Strangers (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (44:43) Lee reflects on his friend Michael Murphy -- (45:16) Cherokee Fiddle (Mickey Gilley, Johnny Lee, and the Urban Cowboy Band) -- (49:22) Unidentified fiddle tune (Urban Cowboy Band) -- (49:45) Arnold introduces the break -- (50:08) Arnold addresses the crowd off-air -- (52:30) Arnold and Lee discuss Lee's recent work at WHN -- (54:51) ""Looking For Love"" and a live performance is discussed by Lee and Arnold -- (59:34) Lee, Arnold, and Gilley joke about jumping each other in the charts -- (1:03:00) Gilley reflects on missing his first Christmas, and Arnold inquires about the groups future aspirations
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Lee, Johnny, 1946-; Gilley, Mickey;
